result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Robert Souza Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Eric Robert Souza in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Eric Robert Souza in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF191, 15CM68, and 15CM199 @ 11:36 a.m. Agreement stated - State moves to dismiss and read in 15CF191. 15CM68 - Def will plead to charge. 15CM199 Def will plead to all 3 cts. Impose and stay 1 yr jail - 15CM68 - 3 months jail imposed & stayed, consecutive, 18 months probation, concurrent, no contact w/R. J., counseling as deemed necessary, costs. Restitution $1334.11 to Crime Victims Compensation from read in file. 15CM199 imposed & stayed 9 months jail on each ct, concurrent to each other consecutive to 15CM68.  18 months probation,concurrent, w/same conditions. Court questions ct 1 jail. State agrees would be 3 months jail. State has complied with victim rights. Atty Morgan and Def agree. Plea quest. reviewed. 16CM68 ct 1 - no contest plea. 16CM199 ct 1 - no contest plea. Ct 2 - no contest plea. Ct 3 - no contest plea. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in 15CF191. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Morgan satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 15CM68 disorderly conduct and 15CM199 ct 1 disorderly conduct, ct 2 crim damage to property and ct 3 crim trespass to dwelling. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Nothing by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will follow agreement. 15CM68 - 3 months jail imposed & stayed, 18 months probation, counseling deemed appropriate, no contact w/R.J., restitution $1334.11 as stated, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Credit for 95 days served if revoked. 15CM199 Ct 1 - 3 months jail imposed and stayed, 18 months probation, concurrent, counseling deemed appropriate, no contact w/R.J., court costs, DNA surcharge. Ct 2 - 9 months jail imposed & stayed, 18 months probation, concurrent w/same conditions.  ct 3 -  9 months jail imposed & stayed, 18 months probation, concurrent w/same conditions. Credit for 95 days served if revoked. 15CM199 jail is consecutive to 15CM68 but concurrent to each other. Huber.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 8, 2017 at 11:30 am.
to Adjourn Jury Trial
State's Motion in Limine and Response to Defendant's Motions in Limine
State's Proposed Jury Instructions

Final pre-trial on January 23, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on February 8, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Andrew M. Morgan not in court.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls  @ 1:02 pm.  State heard on motion why needs case adjourned.  State has called and left message and email Atty Morgan with no responds. Motion in Limine emailed to Atty Morgan.  Court called Atty Morgan and left message on answering machine before going on the record. Court grants motion to adjourn jury trial.  COC to notify jurors. DA will try to contact R.M. one of defense witness.

Jury trial on January 11, 2017 at 09:00 am.

No contact with Ryan Joerns,  No use of alcohol.  Not to present in taverns

Defendant Eric Robert Souza in court, via video, in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 1:37 pm  Def before the court on a warrant.  Statement by Atty Galen Bayne-Allison.  Court reviews file.  State gives recommendations for bond.  Requesting $2500.00 cash bond.  Court set bond.  Def instructed to contact an atty.  (Warrant vacated)  Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Eric Robert Souza not in court.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def failed to appear for final pretrial on 8-29-16.  State is requesting warrant, state wide, body only.  Court reviews court record.  Notice was sent.  Court will authorize warrant, body only, state wide

Final pre-trial on August 29, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on September 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric Robert Souza in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  15CF191, 15CM68 & 15CM199 @ 8:34 am.  State is ready to proceed.  Joseph Husnick, City of Antigo Police Dept, duly sworn on oath, testifies.  Officer Husnick reviews report. State rest.  Court finds probable cause & binds over.  Information Filed.  Atty Morgan has copy of information, waives reading & enters Not Guilty plea. Court receives Not Guilty plea & directs Clerk to enter into record. Atty Morgan has motion on 15CM68 that is same date of 15CF191.  State replys to 15CM68 and would request case to consolidated. Atty Morgan agrees.  Court will consolidate 15CM68 & 15CF191. Def. doesn't have to appear for Status Cnf.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
- Defendant's

Defendant Eric Robert Souza in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews file.  Complaint received, waive reading of complaint.  Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.  Def agrees.    Bond will continue with conditions  Status conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Bail Bond
No contact with R. J.  No use of alcohol.  No presence in taverns.

Defendant Eric Robert Souza in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Morgan represents def on previous case.  Atty Morgan has not been appointed.  State request signature bond with condition.  No objections.  Bond set by court  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
